name: Deel
description: The deel is a traditional Mongolian clothing item, usually made from silk, cotton, or wool. It has a distinctive design with a wide cut and high collar.

name: Tsaatan Coat
description: The Tsaatan coat is worn by the Tsaatan people, an ethnic group of reindeer herders. It's made from reindeer hide and provides warmth in the harsh Mongolian climate.

name: Khadag
description: The khadag is a ceremonial silk scarf used in various occasions, symbolizing respect and good wishes. It's often presented as a sign of honor and appreciation.

name: Khuudag
description: The khuudag is a traditional Mongolian hat made from felt or sheepskin. It's often worn to keep warm during the cold winters.

name: Zodog
description: The zodog is a traditional Mongolian vest, typically worn by men. It's often made from colorful fabric and can be decorated with intricate patterns.

name: Gutul
description: The gutul is a type of traditional Mongolian boots. They are durable and practical, designed to withstand the challenges of nomadic life.

name: Khaalag
description: The khaalag is a traditional Mongolian headwear, often adorned with decorative elements. It's worn by both men and women.

name: Gutal
description: The gutal is a traditional Mongolian shoe, similar to the gutul boots but more lightweight and suitable for everyday wear.

name: Dergee
description: The dergee is a traditional Mongolian coat, often lined with fur for added warmth. It's commonly worn during winter months.

name: Khantaaz
description: The khantaaz is a traditional Mongolian robe-like clothing item. It's made from silk and often worn during formal occasions.
